Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Abbymac4
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3.5 star studio room. We did get it for a great price considering that it has a great central location in the Sydney CBD. It was a great room, very large, with kitchenette, couch, dining table and Queen bed. The only thing was that it was very old and tired. There were water stains on the curtains, rust on the front of the fridge and small stains on the carpet. All things that you can deal with knowing that this is why it is such a good price for such a good location. It was clean ( I think they could have given the curtains a wash) and very comfortable. The lift was old and slow but it got there. The staff were helpful and friendly. There was a restaurant onsite and a rooftop pool and spa with great views. We also had great views of the city and Hyde park from our room. There is a bottle shop next door and convenience shop across the road. Would I stay here again? - yes - if I got the room for a competitive price again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Jac T
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the price and location to the Sydney Triathlon. It was in a great location for the triathlon and the price was OK compared to other hotels in Sydney (we were on a budget) but it really does need some work done. A bit tired - time for some serious upgrade I think! The reception staff were nice enough and overall the room was clean and roomy. Just don't go stay here if you are expecting the same as the Oaks in Melb - that is really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location close to Australian Museum”
Reviews.Author: Josie_Jo_Aus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Oaks Hyde Park on a business trip as I needed to be walking distance from the Australian Museum. After reading the reviews I wasn't expecting much but was pleasantly surprised at the size of the 4* studio and found the facilities comfortable and clean. Yes, the building and corridors and lift look old and tired but the room was fine. I was surprised to discover my ensuite had a heated towel rail which was a little bit of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TomkarAdelaide
Reviews.Content: The following are parts of my letter sent to the Oaks Hyde Park after our recent stay. It is very disappointing to say we have yet to receive a reply from them. 'I would like to give you feedback re accommodation I had booked for four of us on March 22, 2012. My husband and I have stayed at the Oaks in Melbourne, Brisbane and Adelaide. On all of our stays, we were impressed with the quality of our accommodation and the hotel itself. Thus, when it was our friends' anniversary and we decided on a trip to Sydney to celebrate, I said I would look after the accommodation and book us a two bedroom apartment at the Oaks Hyde Park. The photos on the internet looked wonderful, as I assumed they would. When we arrived, I was disappointed to see the state of the reception area, it look tired and not up to par with other Oaks. The reception staff were friendly so I looked past that. When we got off the elevator at our floor, the smell of chemical cleaners was over powering. Once again, I let this go knowing our room would be wonderful. Then it only got worse! The state of the door to the room itself was old, worn and dirty. When I opened the door, my heart sank. The room was awful. The furniture in the lounge was worn, walls covered with black scuffs, curtains filthy, kitchen sub-standard and hairs on the floor in the bathroom. I could only apologise profusely to my friends and stated straight away I would go back to reception and see if there was a better room. This I did and the receptionist had a look on her computer and gave me a key to another room. To my further disappointment, that room was worse than the one we were booked in.' Later in day we found much better accommodation. 'My friend and myself went back to the Oaks, gathered our cases and went down to reception to check out. Initially, the receptionist said we would have to pay a cancellation fee, but thankfully after explaining to her our situation and the fact our room looked nothing like the photos on the internet, the room wasn't up to our standards and the smell of chemicals was overpowering, we weren't charged.' We all were truly disappointment with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great room , good location”
Reviews.Author: robert d
Reviews.Content: we stayed here mid feburary and had booked a room for 3 people and found the room to be modern and clean with good views ,the only complaint was the sofa bed our son slept on was very hard ,our king size bed was comfortable, we asked for and got an early check in. The staff were friendly even though reception was busy ,very close to all amenities , we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Yes - If you need an apartment arrangement in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: ajohnsonColorado
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely tired and in need fresh paint, carpet, and drapes, but if you are looking for an apartment during your stay in Sydney, it is worth considering. The location is excellent, as noted by other reviewers, convenient to restaurants and rail lines, and within walking distance to museums, the Royal Gardens, the Opera House and Circular Quay. Our unit was clean and the staff are definitely friendly and helpful. Also, don't miss the great views from the rooftop pool and hot tub! This is a pleasant and convenient place to stay if you set the appropriate expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and great location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki N
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a double and single beds in the studio room , we were upgraded to a studio with a balcony looking over oxford st and college st. We were on 11th floor. The room was clean and tidy, bathroom more then adequate, we had washer/dryer in bathroom which i would not advise using all our white clothes turned grey. However good kitchen facilites for cooking for 2 (or 4). I was travelling with my mother and although it was open planned we were not sleeping right beside each other and she was able to get up and I could sleep in. Very close to Museum station and easy 10 min walk to George st. Hyde Park directly accross rod and good bus transport. We arrived early and as our room was free we were able to check in early with no added cost. Good building manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and they really do their best”
Reviews.Author: Bazz80
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews i was a bit worried about this place. But its a nice place to stay and the staff is friendly. They work really hard to make ur stay a pleasant one. Ok the rooms are a bit old and yes the hallway stinks. But i would def recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for area of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: angusboy02
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed at Oaks for 1 night and had the 1 bedroom suite with kitchen. We stayed in one of the older rooms as it was cheaper and as it was for only 1 night. The location was the best part of the stay as its very convienant and the staff were quite friendly. The location is also prime as its up the road from an Internet cafe, and about 30+ cafe's and clubs. I would definitely recommend this place based on my experience, especially for those on business or checking out Sydney as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay...”
Reviews.Author: mrsing88
Reviews.Content: 3 day sight seeing stay. We are from Melb. - desk staff not very helpful. Tried to get TV working without success. The girl at the counter just laughed and said "yes, the tv's are crap, all our guests have trouble with them" - Room servicing poor- broken glass in kitchenette not disposed of and sink in bathroom or kitchens wiped - Close to train station, cathredral and city centre, but 15-20 min walk to the harbour. - Hallways in hotel a bit smelly- musty, old. - Air con worked well but it was noisy! And the street the hotel was on very noisy, kept up with sirens al night (although there was an incident with the bikies in Kings cross while we stayed there!) - Overall, okay budget accommodation. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Musicmad67
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip overseas and so our first experience in a Sydney hotel. Disappointed with Oxford St. because all of the bars were for gay people. We don't care if you are gay but we would have loved to have found a club to party at which wasn't gay. After reading other reviews we can think of some issues with our room. For example, when we pulled out the couch for a second bed the mattress cover had a blood stain on it, the TV only had 4 channels, the air conditioner was loud and the shower kept stopping during my shower. But...the room was generally clean and it was serviced for each of the 8 nights we stayed. The staff were nice and friendly. The kitchen was well equiped. The pool was clean and had a nice view of surrounding areas. The air con didn't work but was fixed the very next day. We only really stayed in the room for sleeping as we spent most of our time out and about as the hotel is centrally located for shopping and sights.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Karina1912
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a girls night out in the city. The room was large with a view of the city and perfectly located to restaurants and bars in Oxford Street. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely recommend for a reasonably priced city stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, terrible front desk”
Reviews.Author: EnglishMonkey2008
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room over looking the park, it came with all the normal features etc. Clean & tidy, our only fault with the room was the tv didn't pick up any channels, it wasn't a problem as we were out most of the time but would have been very annoying. Our only real problem was the front desk, took 20-30 minutes to check in as they couldn't work the system to retrieve online bookings, the EPOS machine wasn't working (this didn't stop them from trying for about 7-8 times) and generally was a slow service. What made it worse was a senior member of staff floating around in the back office doing nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,dated room”
Reviews.Author: otravez
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio apartment for 6 days, Location is excellent,within walking distance to most of Sydney attractions, tens of restaurants in Oxford street which is around the corner,close to the train station. Our room had hyde park view which was very nice. Room and all the equipments inside were pretty old and in need of renovation, there is parking available in a basement garage which costs 25AUD/night, room price itself was very reasonable for such a great location. I booked the room at www.accommodationsydney.com.au/ , we were welcomed by Inna (the manager) who was very helpful and friendly, she spent time telling us about the nearby shops,restaurants, where to buy tickets etc.which was very useful. If you don't mind slightly old rooms and building then this is a great place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: sljr16
Reviews.Content: We had booked privately for a serviced apartment for 6 people for 3 nights for my best friend's 21st birthday. When we arrived, none of the Oaks concierge staff would help us with our simple enquiries such as where the nearest bus stop was. When the apartment owner showed us to our room, she was extremely rude. She told us to make sure our apartment was spotless, take out the trash and wash the dishes. For a serviced apartment, that didn't sound right. She treated us like we were a bunch of kids on schoolies. The room itself was very basic and old, the floors and walls stained and the glasses in the cupboard dirty. It did not match the photos on the website at all, so it was very misleading. We had booked for 6 people, but the apartment was only 2 rooms - a tiny bedroom and a combined lounge/kitchenette. She told us we could fit 2 people in the bedroom and 3 on pull-out couches in the lounge. We asked about the 6th bed and she told us to put a spare mattress in the kitchen. She wanted us to pull out the kitchen table ourselves and put it in the hallway OUTSIDE OUR ROOM so we could fit a mattress on the floor. Considering we had paid a lot of money to have 6 people in (what we thought was a large) apartment, this was disgusting. She already expected 3 of us to share a fold-out sofa and then put people on the floor? How were 6 girls meant to lift a kitchen table out of the room anyway?? They should have arranged this for us and there certainly shouldn't be anyone sleeping on the floor. As it was, there was only enough towels, pillows and sheets for 5 people, so the birthday girl slept on a dirty, stained mattress on the floor with no pillow or blankets. Now for the state of the room; each mattress was disgustingly dirty complete with hairs, stains and a wretched smell of sweat. The bathroom had giant cockroaches in it. None of us could use the bathroom during the night as it was blocked by mattresses on the floor because there was no room elsewhere. We left in the early hours of the morning and moved to a cheaper and much cleaner hotel. The apartment owner only gave us half the money back despite us only staying one night. Absolutely appalling conditions and disgusting customer service. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as bad as we thought it might be...”
Reviews.Author: Sydneybound2
Reviews.Content: After reading tripadvisor reviews AFTER I made my booking, I was extremely nervous given I had booked 2 apartments for family for 3 nights (through Oaks direct). Well, overall our experience was OK but definitely not 4 star.... Photos on the Oaks website show beautiful apartments with lovely modern furniture and fixtures/fittings. The apartments we stayed in were definitely nothing like the web photos!! The rooms and furniture were quite old but clean enough (apart from chipped walls/tiles, stained curtains). Reminded me of an old school 3 star motel! I think these apartments damage the Oaks quality brand, as I can't see how a 4 star rating can be applied. I have stayed in several 4 star Oaks in Aust and NZ and this place does not even come close.

Reviews.Title: “Book private not through Oaks”
Reviews.Author: Atsbag
Reviews.Content: As these rooms are privately owned you don't know what you are going to get booking through Oaks. I'm surprised Oaks actually put their name to this hotel because they are normally 4star or higher. Check on other websites to find the privately let rooms. These are kept clean and in order. You can see detailed information and photos of the rooms and you even get a free bottle of wine on arrival! We rented a 3 bedroom apartment for 5 friends and it worked out great value, considering the place could actually sleep more than 10. Would be great for big family groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: BlastOff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights following a cruise from Hawaii. Our large studio room was on the "back" side on the 10th floor. It was clean, comfortable & quiet. We could see the fireworks over the harbor from our room/balcony. The rooftop pool, hot tub, & sauna were clean. We used the microwave & fridge in the kitchen, but didn't really cook. Since we were only there for 2 nights it would have been terribly expensive to purchase the necessary "condiments" ie:, salt & pepper, olive oil or butter, etc. There were no ice cubes in the freezer, so I called the front desk & asked if I could get some ice. I was referred to the Super Market on Oxford St. (Maybe only Americans use ice with their cocktails?). The room wasn't "made up" after our first night, but there was no problem getting clean towels & coffee from the front desk. There is no Internet at the hotel, but lots of convenience stores close by that have Internet. We caught the Hop-on/Hop-off bus & it stopped just 2 blocks from the hotel, by the museum on College. It's an easy walk from the hotel to the Royal Botanical Gardens, Circular Quay, etc. For a reasonably priced dinner there are quite a few bistros & restaurants on Stanley St. Take a right when you exit the hotel, Stanley is 2 blocks. Then right on Stanley for about 3 blocks. The area was clean & safe after dark. I would recommend staying here. The front desk service was excellent. Jye was very helpful. You can get a shuttle to the airport from the hotel, make your reservation 24 hours in advance. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: ToniandLol
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on the Hyde Park Plaza,,,,AFTER,,,,,I had booked our 15 night stay,, I was a bit worried,,,,I was expecting the worse,,Well what a surprise my husband and I had when we arrived,,,,The lobby was clean,, The lifts worked and were spotless,,The hallways didnt smell,..There was no rubbish laying around anywhere,,,The pool and spa were lovely and clean,,,The gym was basic but usable,,,,The staff always had a smile and a hello for us ,,,WE WERE SO RELIEVED ....I cant comment on the rooms owned by the hotel as we booked through accommodationsydney and our room was fabulous,,,,,We will always stay at THE HYDE PARK PLAZA when we stay in Sydney from now on ,The location is Brilliant ,,,If you want 5 star standards then stay at a 5 star hotel ,,,,If you want a good value ,clean,friendly hotel ,Then stay at THE HYDE PARK PLAZA ,,,WE LOVED IT ,,,, Toni and Lol ,,,,Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE hotel! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: CazzylikestoTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in October 2011 for 3 nights and every night was a miserable experience. The hotel is very much run down, and they need a turnover in staff aswell. I booked this hotel as I have stayed at the Oaks in Adelaide and Brisbane and both those hotels were fabulous! I did check the photos of the hotel when booking, and it was my mistake that I didn't check Trip Advisor for the reviews. There is NO TV reception in this hotel. You need a manual to turn the tv on and upon questioning why you only get 4 analogue channels, they say its because they don't own the aerial! I do not know what Sunshinegirl044 is talking about, 'being tired' has nothing to do with it. The rooms are shabby, the bathroom has some shoddy patching up to say the least, and we had a quilt on the bed - BUT NO QUILT COVER. Be warned, do not stay at this hotel, you will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and grave concerns with staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dixonlj3
Reviews.Content: With my parents visiting from the UK, I was hoping to provide them with a treat by staying at Oaks Hyde Park Plaza. Having stayed in Oaks apartments around Australia, I did not look at reviews on TripAdvisor because they have all been to a high standard. I have learnt from this error. On arrival, we were able to check in early which was very kind of hotel staff. On seeing the room, I was so disappointed. There were holes in the kitchen worktop, the dishwasher was not working (which was essential as we were travelling with a 1 year old and would be eating in every night). The bedrooms were also too small to open your suitcase on the floor. I returned to the front desk and asked to be reallocated which was kindly done. However, the reception team were not surprised at my request - as if it was something they did regularly. The second room was better, but I would not estimate it as 4*. The lobby area also smelled like a public set of toilets - not a good first impression. We had a set of keys 'stolen' from the swimming pool. Having alerted reception staff, they agreed to phone if the keys were found. The keys were handed in by a STAFF member 4 hours after they disappeared. On speaking to said receptionist in the morning, she gave us a most unsatisfactory answer as to how she ended up with the keys, and why it took her 4 hours to hand the keys in. We felt the staff were untrustworthy and would advise people who have to stay here to exercise caution with their possessions. Overall, hugely disappointed, and would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone, and would certainly be wary of any of the Oaks hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “A great location with fab staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinegirl044
Reviews.Content: I arrived very tired from Hong Kong as part of my world trip and was met with a big smile from Tim, who was always happy to help with everything from directions to get around or how to turn the TV on...(yes my fault being tired..lol). The room was just what I needed to make a quick breakfast and get out for sightseeing. The location was great to get around and the views of Hyde Park as well as the fab roof top pool. But the icing on the cake for this hotel is the staff and the williness to go the extra mile, when my airport transfer didn't arrive Molly was on the phone tryying to help me, even though I had arranged this in England and it was not their transfer or problem. When it was clear I could miss my plane Tim grabbed my cases and got me a taxi, thank you so much. I would recommend this place as excellant value for money with a fab service.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in.....”
Reviews.Author: Halesy07
Reviews.Content: Noisy, run down rooms. The gym Is outside and equipment is rusty. Internet is not included, even WiFi in lobby is charged for. Don't bother!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff and location make this place....”
Reviews.Author: Meagan F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this motel twice now, the first time was in Aug 2011 and I found the property to be rather dirty and old. The staff were not rude but busy and not really happy to be there either. The room would have been ok but it was noisy (street noise and plumbing) and needed a lot more attention to cleanliness and presentation. Coffee stains on the bench, mouldy curtains and broken bulbs. Pity because the location was fantastic and view was delightful I needed to return in October and found a cheap rate online for the motel, having stayed at an Oaks before I thought to perhaps give it another shot and give them the benefit of the doubt...still a little dubious. What a change. It hasn't been refurbed but it sure has been cleaned up. The lifts have been cleaned up especially and the building and rooms are immaculate. While it's still old and crying out for a big refurb its clean and the staff are a lot more friendlier this time around. As I was there for a week I met most of the staff at the front desk, in particular a special mention to Tim and Dean. Both lads were very keen to assist and very good to me and seemingly the rest of the guests. I later learned Dean is the one actually managing the motel, and his very enthusiastic and friendly attitude and presentation seems to have rubbed off on the place which is good. What an improvement!! I hope they spend $$ on the rooms though as there is no getting away from the fact it is still very old and tired. I will be back though, and will certainly recommend to others! I look forward to seeing more improvements when I next return.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best bit”
Reviews.Author: Jane099_11
Reviews.Content: The rooms look better on the web site than they are in real life. The apartment was tidy and clean but as another reviewer has said VERY tired...marked paintwork, stained curtains, odd numbers of crockery, cutlery and a missing robe hook on the bathroom door leaving a hole. There were no instructions in the rooms for electical appliances or a welcome/explanatory book in the room, which was frustrating (reception came to the rescue with operating the microwave). Oaks only manage these apartments as I found out from the front desk, so it is up to the owners to provide that information. We had a studio room that had a locked interconnecting door that proved to be less than sound proof, luckily the "neighbours" weren't there for the duration of our stay. All this aside the location suited us well; we walked, trained, bused everywhere, and found it so central. The front desk were exceptionally helpful especially Mollie who was always bright and cheery and keen to assist.

Reviews.Title: “The worst accomodation ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luella L
Reviews.Content: We booked for 7 nights based on pics we has seen on the web! Nothing like what we saw, an absolute disgrace tired, old, run down, stunk, dirty, squashy. We booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with a sofa bed out in the lounge area & a cot for our 1yr old. We arrived to a big mess, no sofa bed, no cot, 1 bathroom, no dishwasher, an old tired hotel with a disgusting lift that has worn out carpet & stunk of vomit!! The roof top pool was old worn tired looked scary!! The out door gym was weather worn & all ripped leather. We definitely didn't use either of them. The daily service was a crap, the cleaners refused to vacum until I complained, they cleaned the the bathroom with dish washing detergent & never wiped over a single cupboard the whole time, we felt sick & couldn't wait to get out of there every day. The only reason we stayed on was because we couldn't get in anywhere else, but boy did we try!!! I would totally recommend you look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: stan h
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept 2011 for 1 week. It should be remembered that all the apartments are privately owned, consequently the standards may well differ considerably. We, wife, self and close friend stayed in apt 900, 2 bedroom 9th floor. The furniture was clean and comfortable. I was restricted by an attack of gout for 3 days, but the girls went off and enjoyed themselves. The rooftop pool was clean and pleasantly warm, the sauna took about 20 mins to heat up, but was fine after that. Also nearby shower very convenient. Maybe the people before us in the apartment were not as fastidious as they might have been, it was a bit dusty, but that's being a bit picky. The dining chairs were just beginning to show their age, but the owner pointed out that a bit of a refurb. was on the cards. Don't complain about the noise, you are in the middle of a busy city. I know the emergency services like their 'blues n twos' but that's the way of it, I'm afraid. The desk staff we found to be very helpful. The Thai restaurant is part of the building, but we noticed no food smells other than in the restaurant, which I thought was good value by the way. The trips we went on picked up & dropped off at the door with no hesitation. All in all, good value, and would not rule out using the place again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Allen A
Reviews.Content: Construction noise( drilling noise) woke me up at 7 AM. Unbelievable...

Reviews.Title: “Only for the location”
Reviews.Author: Raidenhaus
Reviews.Content: This place was awful. Having asked twice by email for a quiet room, we got one overlooking the traffic lights on a busy crossroad. On asking for a change, we were given another room a few floors up, but in the same location. In this apartment hotel, the guest is the enemy. The kitchen benchtop had crumbs and small foodscraps from the previous guest. I flicked it all on to the floor, where it stayed for four days. The TV was HD capable, but the HD stations had not been programmed in. Our toaster was missing and when I went to the foyer to ask for one, the receptionist hissed that she would have one sent up. It arrived at 11am the next day. We couldn't make the remote control work the airconditioner. After pushing all the buttons repeatedly, I asked the receptionist if he could show me how to use it. "No", he said, "Just keep pushing all the buttons." The bathroom light only worked intermittently. The front door is locked at 10pm but they supplied us with a zapper supplied to work the after hours door. On our first night, we returned from dinner at 11pm and the zapper didn't work. Fortunately, another guest let us in. I asked for a new zapper next day and the receptionist said "why don't you use the front door?" We stayed in what they called a renovated apartment, as some of them were called older style. We found out thet they were last renovated about 15 years ago, but were still called "the renovated apartments." There wasn't a comfy chair in the apartment and it was rather tired. Carpets in public areas were badly worn on some floors. I would stay here only for the fantastic location and views of Hyde Park, but there are half a dozen better places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: aussied0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel overnight prior to going on a cruise and found it absolute ideal for the purpose as it was so close to Bangaroo Wharf 5 from where the Sun Princess sailed. A little bit bemused on arrival at 9 pm as we had booked twin beds when making the reservation at the desk to be told that the hotel 1. had upgraded us to a suite --good and 2. that the second bed was a roller bed â€“ bad. However the suite was excellent, the service cheerful and the breakfast sustaining.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with below average customer service”
Reviews.Author: Melisa9
Reviews.Content: Although in a good location, this hotel has seen better days. The rooms were tired, at best. Our room window was gaffa taped up to stop the wind whistleling through. The room was clean. The couch was one of the most uncomfortable I have ever sat on. The pictures on the internet are reflective of the rooms, perhaps 10 years ago when everything was new and fresh. Definitely not a four star hotel! Two at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Very dissapointed with Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kel044
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in July with my husband and two friends. When we landed Sydney was covered in rain. Couldnt wait to get to the hotel. On arrival we were a hour early for check in at 2pm and were informed by Andrea who lacked customer service skills our room wasnt ready as yet and would deffinately be ready by 2pm. At 1.50 we returned and were told room still wasnt ready and I demand she check us in and then we would wait until room was ready. 2.30pm came still waiting cold and wet in the lobby and they then had to change our room. We stayed on the 14th floor in the end and could hear people complaining about bad smells on the 6th floor. The lift was dirty, old and I believe a OHS issue. Get up to the 14th floor and by the look of the hallways was scared to what our room would be. Was a complete joke and NOTHING to what is described on the internet. Tables were filthy carpet old and rotten, hair all over the bathroom floor. We had two drinking glasses in the kitchen for four people. My husband rang reception and waited over a hour for glasses, calling twice in the meantime to find there was only two staff on and one cleaner on a Friday afternoon. Went to look at the "GYM" and almost fell over. It was a embarressment! Old rusted and not even in a roon was on the roof under a dodgy little cover. Pool , spa and sauna almost made me throw up. Only good thing about this place is the location. We could walk everywhere, walked to the opera house, monorail, Centre point, city centre,everywhere... Would advise anyone who is thinking this hotel looks great and is thinking of staying DONT! It looks great on the Internet but in person, its a wreck! Ive stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels and service is great, this mob need to return to there hospitality courses to learn how to treat valued paying customers, was absolutely pathetic!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comforatable room”
Reviews.Author: wattsrr
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for holidaying in central Sydney. Just out of the CBD, overlooking Hyde Park and close to the train (Hyde Park station) Near to IGA store, good cafes (Try Alexander's on the Park - great breakfasts and lunches and not expensive with a view over the park). Very confortable asnd spacious room. Reception people were very polite and he;pful. We eould stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Low Expectations, Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: SuperDragonX
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TripAdvisor we weren't sure what to expect, however we were pleased with the standard of this hotel. While staying at another Oaks' location in Sydney had skewed our expectations, we were still quite pleased with this hotel in general. Only issue was the SINGLE bathroom in a two-bedroom apartment; especially when shared among 6 males. Oh the humanity! Would stay here again. Note: Make sure that if you pay cash that the transaction is noted down; we payed cash and put the bond on my credit card, later the whole transaction was put onto my credit card without my approval. I was eventually given the CASH back, however this was a nuisance. Make sure you cover yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Hugros
Reviews.Content: Despite the tempting accommodationsydney pictures this appartment block is in dire need of complete renovation. Shabby interiors and tired furniture; it is single-glazed and dreadfully noisy at night being on an intersection. It is centrally placed and very convenient for the City but the positives stop there. It served our purposes but I would not go back again and cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: the_ange23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night with a group of friends. The room was a good size to accommodate us all. It was not anything fancy but was clean and had everything we needed. Location is pretty good too - you can either walk to most places or catch a bus/train or get a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Adelguy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great easy access from the train station and easy walk into the CBD. Hotel was basic however the price I paid for the room reflected that. The room requires upgrading and looking a bit worn in places. The air conditioning is really noisy which was the only downside to the room. Overall though the price I paid for the room provided me with a basic hotel room with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer494963
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel. The location was very good as it is close to Central Station and with Hyde Park just opposite is within easy (and pleasant) walk to Circular Quay (half hour), Darling Harbour (20 mins) and a few minutes to the shops, tower etc. We had cooking facilities, fridge, TV in the room and the use of laundry and roof top pool. Considering the busy roads outside it was amazingly quiet at night. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy air con”
Reviews.Content: hotel was okay for the price. air con was very noisy and I don't think it would have worked sufficiently if temps had been above 25c. hotel does need refurbished but this was reflected in price. staff at front desk were courteous and helpful

Reviews.Title: “A complete rip off! Buyer beware... move along and select ANYWHERE else!”
Reviews.Author: StayWhenAway
Reviews.Content: At over $1,500NZD for 3 nights we were expecting a reasonable 2 bedroom apartment. It's rated at 4.5 stars and looks fantastic on the website..... but a dump!!! The mirror was falling out of the wardrobe and was quite dangerous, the room was dirty with a fingernail on the bed, kitchen cupboards falling off, walls were marked and dirty and this was presumably to match the stains on the couch and carpet!! The couch had a wooden board sticking out from under the cushions and was very uncomfortable, not to mention tacky. My Mum was surprised that the cheap towels didn't even cover her lady bits and she is not large by any means!!!! We called reception after working out the number to call (thanks to a missing room compendium) and the team at the desk didn't seem to give a damn, supposedly because they are used to disappointed guests. We also mentioned that the bath didn't drain and the room had not been cleaned properly. (Room service was so bad that they may as well not bothered.) The beds were ok and that was good considering the curtains didn't close so an early start for all! We repeatedly complained and I even emailed the Manager (Sharon Wallace) during the stay and after 3 days we never heard from her! 4.5 stars... really???? So 4.5 stars they say??? One would expect a modern TV without cables all over with clear reception, unlike what we have. Yes, I'm keeping it short and have not mentioned all the other items that require attention.... I even took pictures! At the very end we received a pathetic discount of $180AUD off the account...... but not a call from the manager! While we were checking out an English lady was fuming and complaining at reception and she had the exact same complaints that we did - she had stayed in other Oaks apartments and said that these ones were DISGUSTING and she simply refused to pay - what a pity I gave them my credit card. My Mum was surprised that the cheap towels didnt even cover her lady bits and she is not large by any means. We called reception after working out the number to call (thanks to a missing room compendium) and the team at the desk didnt seem to give a damn, supposedly because they are used to disappointed guests. We also mentioned that the bath didnt drain and the room had not been cleaned properly. The beds were ok and that was good considering the curtains didnt close! We wanted the Manager to know... and after 3 days we never heard from her (Sharon Wallace). So 4.5 stars they say??? One would expect a modern tv without cables all over with clear reception, unlike what we have. Yes, I'm keeping it short and have not mentioned all the other items that require attention.... I even took pictures! At the very end we received a pathetic discount of $180AUD off the account...... but not a call from the manager! While we were checking out an English lady was funing and complaning at reception and she had the exact same complaints that we did - she had stayed in other Oaks apartments and said that these ones were DISGUSTING and she simply refused to pay - what a pity I gave them my credit card. Oh, and just to end off, THIS HOTEL IS NOT EVEN COMPLIANT - THERE IS NO FIRE SAFETY - No room compendium, numbers to call or evacuation information on the door!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value 3 star”
Reviews.Author: hildaPerthWA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and if you are travelling with family or a small group the apartments are great value. The service is average and the decor is jaded but this is outweighed by the price and the location. A good budget hotel in the heart of Sydney. CBD is within walking distance and it is close to train station and museums.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing good is its location!”
Reviews.Author: NellyC76
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed when we arrived at the Oaks Hyde Park Plaza, I wrongly assumed that Oaks was a reputable hotel chain and it would be of a certain standard - WRONG!!! Don't be fooled by the lobby, it's deceiving. You only need to step into the elevator to work out that this is a very old, tired hotel that needs a total overhaul. If you haven't worked it out after travelling in the elevator, you'll definitely know it when you arrive on your floor and find that the numbers are written by hand on the doors!!!!!!! We stayed in a two bedroom apartment, which had a very poky kitchen and an even smaller bathroom. It was very uncomfortable to say the least, the couches weren't even pleasant to sit on! One of our bedrooms had a very suspicious red stain in the carpet, it looked quite fresh. This was proved to be true when two cleaners arrived at our door unannounced to clean the stain. We had no call from reception to let us know they were on their way up, and when I called reception they were very vague about what was going on. Needless to say we asked the cleaners to return at another time! The pool area is surprisingly nice with a great view over the city. The only thing that I can say this hotel has going for it is its location, you walk out your door and Hyde Park is across the road, or you can go up Oxford street where there's some good restaurants. But I don't think location is enough of a reason to stay at this place!

Reviews.Title: “Accomodek”
Reviews.Author: brianpalexander21
Reviews.Content: We found the appartment let by them to be in a very poor state of repair and cleanliness. No attention had been made to clean the cooking facilities or furniture and the soiled bedding, covered by clean sheets, was extremely bad. The company lets a number of falts throughout Sydney, but based on what we expereicned we do not belive you can trust that they are looking after these roperly and lceaning is a 10 minute execrise onyly on chargeover.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old, run down, definitely not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: jazz629
Reviews.Content: Check in went smoothly and staff were courteous. Booked 4 star room for a four night stay, the room was not 4 star. The room was very tired looking and the furniture was very well worn with an iron scorch on the arm of the chair. Bed was very firm but clean. Bathroom was small and clean except for the mold in the corner of the room. Nasty smells in the hallways. The room we stayed in overlooked an interior courtyard so the room was quiet, but the courtyard was very dirty with rubbish and clothing which had blown into it. Excellent location in Sydney and we managed to get the room for a good price, which was the only thing I felt the hotel had going for it. Overall this hotel needs a good clean and an update.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book here!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn049
Reviews.Content: We rented an apartment through accommodationsydney.com. Beware - they use this hotel. We paid more than $3000Aus for 11 nights over New Year and to coincide with the Ashes Test match. The air conditioning leaked and we had to empty buckets and mop the floor with towels. Becasue of the heat we had to leave windows open and were badly bitten by mosquitoes. Despite alleged fixing, the problem continued. We were moved to a different apartment for our last two nights, however there was no apology and no offer of compensation. The hotel building itself was very dirty, shabby and in need of total refurbishment. The bars and restaurants were not open. Extortionate price and dreadful accommodation. The trip of a lifetime was marred considerably.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but still acceptable”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereDC
Reviews.Content: This place really needs a serious rehab. Dingy furnishing, misaligned doors and cabinets, noisy fan. Outrageous internet charges. The location is extra noisy because of traffic starting up from the light on Oxford Street.

Reviews.Title: “very very substandard”
Reviews.Author: Haggis09
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 bedroom apartment for one night, at a cost of $385, thought we would have a decent room at this price - wrong... the room was very shabby and old. The air conditioning hardly worked - we could not sleep for the heat in the bedrooms. The TV also didn't work. I would never stay again and would not recommend it to my worst enemy. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Oaks Hyde Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: greenfrogBrisbane
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights at the Oaks Hyde Park Plaza through wotif for my mother and I during our recent holiday to Sydney and became a little concerned after reading all the bad reviews. We purchased a 4 day special for a 4 star 1 bedroom apartment - $129 per room per night. We were initially put into a 3 star 1 bedroom apartment (we'd booked a 4 star) this was clean, roomy and comfortable (see photos) but extremely noisy at night so after two nights, I asked to be moved to a quieter apartment and within 30 minutes we were upgraded to a much higher floor to a 4 star 1 bedroom apartment (see photos) which is what I'd booked in the first place. At the rear of the hotel and soooo much quieter with a huge balcony and glimpses of the Sydney Harbour. This room was luxury plus and so spacious and comfortable - it would've been an awesome 4 day holiday if we'd been given this apartment in the first place as we would've had a much better nights sleep. The location of the hotel is ideal, the 555 free bus is just across from Hyde Park which is located at the entrance of the hotel, as well as the Museum train station and all buses to Bondi Beach, Kings Cross, etc. Restaurants in abundance with Pitt Street only a 5 mins walk and Darling Harbour a 15 mins walk. I found the staff to be extremely pleasant and nothing was ever too much trouble - if they didn't know an answer they would google search the answers for us on the spot. We bought takeaway Thai food from the hotel restaurant and found this to be of very good quality and value for money. Rooftop swimming pool - not used as too cold during our visit but great views from there and spa/gym also on rooftop. Pending what you are paying for your stay obviously depends on the room you get but this should not affect the service you receive !! Overall I could not fault this hotel except for the noisy corner rooms - ENSURE you request a room at the back and you shouldn't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: elsangel
Reviews.Content: Although the room had not been cleaned properly (there were chocolate wrappers left behind and cigarette ash) I had no problems until the next day when I came out in bites. Thinking they were mozzies, I waited two days before seeking medical attention only to be told by the dr that they were bedbugs. I then sought a second opinion and the dr confirmed that yes, they were bedbugs. I rang the hotel and they supposedly got a pest certificate stating there were no bedbugs, but the bites tell the story.

Reviews.Title: “Would I consider coming back again? YES!”
Reviews.Author: hippopochibi
Reviews.Content: I was desperately looking for an apartment over New Year and finally after a few hour of research I found a 4-star 1-bedroom apartment in Oaks Hyde Park Plaza with a good price. I was very excited until I read the reviews a day later and to be honest, they really freaked me out! I was very worried about the room I was getting etc and a couple of times rang the reception to make sure the room was of good conditions and everything in there worked fine. The staff was very patient with answering and following up my enquiries on the phone. When I got there, I was relieved that the serviced apartment was MUCH better than what I expected after reading the reviews. I agreed that the building was relatively old compared to other serviced apartments in the CBD, but it appeared that the inside of the rooms had been refurbished. The lift was normal, not super slow as quoted previously. Maybe it was just really busy when it was super slow. The reception/ staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and spacious and had a very artsy interior. Although it was only on the 3rd floor, we had a great view with the living room facing Oxford St and our bedroom facing Hyde Park. The kitchen was modern and sleek. Everything (TV, air conditioner) worked fine. Fresh towels provided free of charge if you put them on the floors before the cleaners came or you could collect them at the reception at any time. I really loved their shampoo/conditioner/body lotion packages (not important, but still a plus). At night it was not noisy at all (unless an ambulance passed by) and we had comfortable sleep each night. Also, if you are not an early bird like us, make sure you contact the reception/ cleaning service before 2 pm as they are only around between 10 am - 2 pm. The pool/ spa was good with great views although I think the pool needs to be cleaned more regularly. The internet/ Wi-fi service is pretty expensive but hey if you are here for some retreat/ get away, who really needs internet! If you are desperate for it, there were some internet cafes around with pretty cheap rates or go to the Apple Store in George St! Location wise it was very central, and with the free shuttle bus 555 you can practically go anywhere roaming around the town! I was definitely very happy to have stayed there. It was a cute, cozy little apartment that made me feel like home and I would definitely come back and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “WORST APARTMENT STAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: raistlindax
Reviews.Content: WORST SERVICE APARTMENT IVE EVER STAYED AT!!!!! Rooms are old, and very poorly maintained. The lifts smell like urine and chlorine. One of the lifts was down when I first checked in. There are 2 VERY old hydraulic lifts. They charge $2 for fresh towels. Laundry is about $8 to wash and dry. They also charge $150 bond on top of the room charge. They dont change the sheets, just make the bed. Dont provide any toiletries. Overpriced (roughly $200 a night). Location is ok... but a few streets down are WAY better places to stay at better prices Furniture is old and drab. Service is terrible, reception was not professional, unfriendly and unhelpful are the words that describe this place Very unlike the Oaks in Melbourne. Definitely will NEVER stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: eevee2
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a great holiday in Sydney and we were really happy with our apartment in the oaks hyde park .Ours was a private 2 bdrm apartment booked through Waldek Stepnik from http://www.sydneyapartmentcentre.com/Apartments/syd08-900_Hyde%20Park_Apartment.htm. It was on the 9th floor at the back of the building so we weren't bothered by any traffic noise (except for our first night when there was some music playing till midnight and quite afew sirens.It was a friday night and it was quiet the rest of the week.) I was so worried after reading all the bad reviews on here and was expecting the worst.Instead we arrived at our lovely clean and really well equipped apartment,It had good quality fixtures and fittings and everything worked perfectly well.It was much roomier than I expected and the children loved the pool on the rooftop. It was a fantastic location and Waldek was very efficient and friendly when making the booking. Thinking about bad comments on here about a smell, well there was a bit of a smell in the lobby(probably from the thai restaurant?) but no smell upstairs.The lifts were a little slow but worked fine so all in all a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Oaks Hyde Park is a dump”
Reviews.Author: GEEZ49
Reviews.Content: We booked the 4 star, 2 bedroom 2 Bathroom apartment..........oh did I say 2 bathroom. They dont have 2 bathroom apartments, so firstly the staff have no idea what the rooms have in them. Second the room we booked into was filled with a paint haze, and we have a child with asthma. We had to request that the painter stop work while we where in the apartment. The phone from the room to reception does work or was it just that they ignored the phone ringing from the rooms. The lift was out of order, we discovered we could use the service lift which had been urinated in...4 days later the urine was still there. The aircon wasnt working, four days later ( on our last night) the aircon was fixed.

Reviews.Title: “very dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lee D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of upgrading and could improve its customer service . Room small, not as advertised. Chair and door handle broken and lifts out of order on more than one occassion. This caused stress for 80 year old aunt. Had to ask for essentials like tissues and TP, shampoo and soap, not restocked in daily service. The up side was the location, convenient to transport and sight seeing. There are many other choices in hotels for the same price that are better value for money, dissappointing experience

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, opposite Hyde Park, but unbelievably noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: jaccsun
Reviews.Content: Our Refurbished 4* studio had two single beds in the main room and a queen bed in the other bedroom. Plenty of room and the self-contained kitchen, though very dated and shabby, was a money-saver. Our room was on the corner of the building overlooking the very, very busy Oxford/Liverpool crossroad intersection so we overlooked five busy streets! The noise from the traffic in our room was unbelievable, non-stop and disturbed our sleep. No chance of a sleep-in which did not please my 18yo daughter. You could hear the noise of sirens even from the bathroom over the noise of the shower! The bathroom was very shabby and the room generally was in need of some paint. The air con in the other bedroom turned itself on overnight and leaked water onto the carpet. Continued to do so even after we reported it. A big plus was the location - very central to the main attractions of Sydney, many within comfortable walking distance and beautiful Hyde Park opposite. Staff were cool and not very friendly. The hotel has a nice heated rooftop pool and spa area, but no seating at all provided so it wasn't very user-friendly. It could have been a nice area to eat a meal as there was room for some outdoor tables and chairs. Great Thai restaurant on-site with excellent service. No information in the room whatsoever on hotel services or tourist attractions and no room service. No ashtray or seats on the tiny balcony though the hotel claims to cater for smokers. Service was ordinary. The dish detergent and dishcloth weren't replaced two out of four days. Wouldn't stay there again. There are other hotels that would be better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky Smell and very old facilities”
Reviews.Author: Joyer10
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights as we booked online. The location is good as it is close to the Hyde Park and train station. However the hotel is very old. We were given a room on the 2nd level with conference room besides. It smells very smoky on the whole level and very noisy. I suspect the hotel tries to put every one on the 2nd level as much as possible. Therefore do insist on room change if you given rooms on the 2nd level. We finally move to the 15th level with much better condition. however there are few pitfalls: - There is no fan for air circulation so the kitchen can not be used for cooking heavily - As posted by other reviewers there are always some cooking smells coming from nowhere and we have to turn on the aircon all the day to avoid that. Next time we would have to look for other places.

Reviews.Title: “Total disappointment”
Reviews.Author: vicoListed
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1204 a two bedroom four star room. It was shabby and tired in desperate need of a repaint and a proper clean. We stayed for one night, glad it wasn't longer.

Reviews.Title: “Location but little else. . .”
Reviews.Author: Darnoc
Reviews.Content: An outdated building featuring tired kitchen units and a high price with a great location on Hyde Park with good transportation connections. Deferred maintenance has left it in poor shape with banged up walls, patched paint and ancient kitchen appliances. While the suite was spacious, it was hardly better than two stars. Whoever called this a 3.5 star suite was at least legally blind. Staff could not answer routine questions and the Internet was NOT free ($90/week) and connected with a wire. The view through the grungy windows was of beautiful Hyde Park. Groceries and wine nearby made the site convenient and shopping is amazing if you want it. Walk to ferries and the bus stop is within 100 metres. Would I stay here again? Not if I could find anything remotely similar nearby. PS: Moved the couch and found dust bunnies. Not vacuumed under there in age.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy in 4 star room...”
Reviews.Author: speegalNewPlymouth
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 stayed in this apartment for 3 nights over a weekend. 6 of us stayed in 4 star rooms and they were clean, modern and very comfortable to sleep in. They contained a fully equipped kitchen (even in the studio), balcony and clean bathroom (although the water pressure was low). However, the other 2 stayed in the 3 star room and they were appalled. I had a look and it wasn't good. It had dirty carpet, dirty bathroom, rubbish on the floor and the sofa bed didn't even fold out. My major recommendation is that you MUST stay in the 4 star room. The other aspects of the hotel were mixed, the check in process was slow and laboured as was the lifts to the rooms. The keys needed to be remagnetised after 2 days. However, the swimming pool area up on the roof was fantastic. The pool was very warm and clean, as was the spa and gym. The location was perfect for our group as it was close to Kings Cross, the SCG but also close enough to the CBD. Overall I would stay here again, but definitely in a 4 star room.

Reviews.Title: “Very outdated but decent for 1 night stay as long as you don't need any service.”
Reviews.Author: RandomStayz
Reviews.Content: Having booked without checking the reviews as we were in a real hurry, was expecting the very worst as when checking out the reviews at the airport . The Oaks Hyde Park is desperately in need of a complete overhaul with the rooms very outdated and needing pretty much everything serviced if not replaced. However, it wasn't quite as bad as some of the reviews would suggest and probably decent for a 1 night stay if you only plan to sleep there as the location in quite central. On the upside, the location is great (cnr of College and Oxford) and as we had a room facing away from both main streets, it was very quite. The Thai restaurant down stairs was pretty decent and for Sydney prices, $140 in a self contained studio wasn't too bad. On the downer, the place itself is very run down and the service is non-existent. The bed was slanted, the bathroom just barely ok and forget cable TV, you'll get an old TV with fuzzy reception. I'd only recommend this place to party goers who just need a bed to sleep on and nothing more coz it doesn't offer anything but the basics. However, if you need a cheap place to crash after a night of drinking, it's not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Sydney!!!”
Reviews.Author: ozbiz
Reviews.Content: Booked this 'hotel' via wotif.com for a business trip from Monday 22nd Feb till Thurs 25th Feb. Travelled with my partner and HATED it the minute our taxi pulled outside this 'hotel'. 'Hotel' patrons were smoking and DRINKING ALCOHOLIC beverages out of cans near the doorway to the entrance! I had specifically requested a very quiet room and repeated this request to the receptionist who acknowledged me. We were given a room on the 9th floor FACING THE STREET!....All we heard the entire night was buses, cars screeching, people yelling, traffic etc. We had the airconditioner going to try to block out the noise and keep the room cool, but my partner had an asthma attack due to the dust billowing out of the vents. As for the room itself, basic but dirt smeared curtains....ABSOLUTELY APPALLING!!!!... It's not a 'hotel' or even a decent serviced apartment. We left one day early as we have not properly slept for days!...WE HATE THIS PLACE....DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!....We will be back in Sydney for business and will be more careful when booking...will probably stay at the Westin or Sheraton on the Park.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid! Avoid! Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: kfish1989
Reviews.Content: Who rated this a 4 1/2* hotel? Self rated I think. Room was literally falling apart. The bed head was about to fall off the wall - was only holding on by a few nails. Our 'King' Bed was 2 single beds put together, the air con leaked onto the carpet leaving a nice wet patch, the 32" flat screen tv (as if) that we were promised was an old TCL tv (not flat screen) with crappy reception. We spoke to the reception as soon as we got to the room to explain that we wanted the bed head and tv fixed and didnt even get a response (dont think the reception girl understood english) the second time we complained the manager visited us and promised to get back to us but never did, the third time we complained we were promised a new room but it never happened so we checked out and stayed elsewhere. we payed $160 per night - complete rip off!!! I will never stay here again and i suggest that no-one else does either. Very disappointing. Very poor on behalf of the management.

Reviews.Title: “no reason to worry about bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Stockinbingal
Reviews.Content: The Oaks Hyde Park is located on the edge of the CBD opposite Hyde Park.Convenient location and easy walking distance to the CBD,Darling harbour,The rocks and China town. even with three children,5yrs,8yrs,10yrs. Check in was smooth and courteous,four star refurbished room,two bedrooms,clean and reasonably modern.Well equipped Kitchen Housekeeping arrived within minutes of arrival to check on extra towels or other requirements. Some outside noise on the Friday night but to be expected in the city. pool amenities were clean as was the small gym. carparking is not undercover but okay. supermarket acrooss the road,bottleshop adjacent as well as numerous takeaway outlets. Taylor square area behind and to the east.Cosmopolitan.Not necessarily where we would walk the children. Overall very good for the three day break,value for money.Would recommend a request for a four star room.some previous reviewers may have stayed in the unrenovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: CanberraScreen_name
Reviews.Content: The rooms are shabby (even the refurbished ones), the staff surly and unable to deal with complaints. One of our group had her personal belongings taken by staff despite her being booked in for the next night. One morning there was no water - probably due to aging and poorly maintained infrastructure. Swim in the pool at your own health risk!

Reviews.Title: “So filthy it made me ill”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbluebell
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump and a rip off! I paid a deposit upfront and was shown my "upgraded" studio which was in my opinion the dirtiest room I have ever stayed in. (The actual corridors, reception and lifts are equaly grubby and broken too.) Additionally the bathroom was just as bad and the loo wouldnt flush which is appalling for a "four star" hotel in Sydney of all places! The room was so dusty that after 10minutes I started coughing and wheezing and my eyes begain to stream. I usually only get this around cats and despite opening the filthy window so I could breath, after another 10 minutes I was a panda eyed itching mess and clearly could not stay there-it was actually making me ill! I have never walked out of a hotel so quick and considering I had just flown for hours, not slept for nearly 30 hours or eaten for many hours and still had my giant case I still wanted to get out. I feel that this place was totally misrepresented online and way overpriced as well. To anyone else who looks at this place or any apartments in it-don't do it, don't do it-go anywhere else! Places like this only exist to con poor unsuspecting tourists - don't be one of them like me.

Reviews.Title: “What a noisy dump”
Reviews.Author: mack9321
Reviews.Content: Booked thru the hotel , was not told that there are jack hammers going from 8am to 4pm as they are renovating.I was given 4 star " renovated " room, pretty basic , there was long dark hair all thru the bathroom ,(I have fair hair ), the curtains were dirty and broken off their tracks ,remote did not work, the bath towels are so thin you need 2 to get dry..The windows are not double glazed so the noise at night is as if you are standing on the street.Tried to ring reception on internal phone to get moved to a quieter room ,no answer so rang the out side line which did answer and was told that I was in the CBD.As if I didn't realize this.Then the following day after I left and paid my bill in full etc my debit card was still showing a debit of $200 which should have never gone thru as it was a deposit in case I trashed the room etc. I travel frequently and all other hotels do not put this charge thru, it is cancelled when you check out and does not even appear on your bank statement. Will never stay again nor would I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Rawiri
Reviews.Content: I walked from a nearby chain hotel after the first night - their room stank (non-smoking booking, yet the room smelt of cigarette smoke as well as being dank.) I noticed Oaks Hyde Park on the internet - this fully self contained room (actual stove/oven as well as microwave) at a mere $9 p/n more than smelly hotel down the hill. There was also on- site parking. The current refurbishment did not concern me, but a loud family occupying next door opposite facing rooms, with their doors open to interconnect with each other via public hallway, did begin to annoy by midnite ! I know that securing a truly self contained room, yes, with proper cooking facilities, at that price was a gift. But when I travel to Sydney next, I'll probably pay more and return to Oaks Hyde Park. And it was very nice that the room did not stink !

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay at the Oaks Hyde Park Plaza again”
Reviews.Author: Surrealisme
Reviews.Content: Note: there is no internet facilities at this hotel. We were flabbergasted by this news upon arrival. You can go to the internet cafe around the corner was the only advice. My first hotel room was on level 2, adorned with a mirror ball and perched right above the busy intersection on top of which the hotel is located. I'd requested a quiet room and was presented with practically the noisiest. The ceiling lights didn't work, one or two lamps did. The room was also shabby and awkwardly appointed. I requested a change. The second room was on level 4 and much better, it at least looked clean, better in layout though still too close to street level and busy College road. The worst aspect of the new room was the stench of day long cooking smells permeating throughout the entire level, a curry doesn't smell so good from this vantage. We weren't sure if it was from the restaurant downstairs, but it was all through level 3 as well where another colleague was placed and level 4. Very unpleasant. Had to leave the air conditioning on to keep the room free of it. The second room itself was ok, though still not to the standard of stars claimed and there was a distinct old(?) bottom imprint on one of the seat cushions in the lounge room. Yes a bottom imprint (or ugg a stain). I do not lie. Of 10 colleagues staying at the same time only 2 were not unhappy with their initial rooms though none thought it worth the value paid and all were dumbfounded by the lack of internet facilities. Thumbs down for this one. Unless you are ok with mirror balls, constant traffic noise, bottom imprints, no internet or decent restaurant. Oh and the first helpful hint inside the customer tips folder in your room is how to pay the bill. Enough said. Stay at the Marriot next door instead.

Reviews.Title: “Last legs”
Reviews.Author: NzHenry
Reviews.Content: Room keycard often worked - only had to go back down 15 floors 11 times to have it recoded.. They always kindly explained that it was my fault. Elevator broke down and beeped loudly for 3 inoperative days. Paint and paper peeling off in large chunks along hallways. Fire alarm went off and an auto message was broadcast to evacuate, so we went down 15 flights of stairs to arrive in the foyer at the same time as the fire brigade. Only one other couple was down there. The person behind the desk was still booking people in and explained that nobody pays attention to the evacuate broadcasts any more. The room was not vacuumed once in the 10 days we were there. Beds were just roughly pulled up, with the sheets and the mattress protector in large, very visible and very difficlt to sleep on, lumps in the bed. Several times we were left no toilet paper. House-cleaning insisted on coming in and doing their inadequate job on two occasions while I was trying to get ready to go out - pretended not to understand English at these times. The hotel's movie system didn't work, so it was just a few TV channels on a very old TV set. The sound level couldn't be turned up and you had to sit really close to the TV to hear it. The carpet edging strip, leading to the kitchen had nails sticking up and they caught your bare feet. Some lights didn't work. Locks were broken on the windows. We needed a wakeup call and it was 45 minutes late - lucky we weren't trying to get to a flight. They said we should use the clock/radio, but there wasn't one. There was no internet access available. I really expected to see a moose head waiting to be hung in the lobby - faulty towers, this one.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbishment needed”
Reviews.Author: Arilh
Reviews.Content: The Oaks Hyde Park Plaza apartments are well located and reasonable deals can be found. Unfortunately these factors are outweighed by the fact that a major overhaul is needed at the premises - previous reports outline some problems. We found old cutlery/crockery/cookers; collapsing drawers and bathroom fitments/furniture and creepy-crawlies. Add to this the fact that the rooms aren't double glazed so there is traffic noise especially from the horn-honkers and drunks at night. Maintenance that would have at least alleviated one of the problems failed to materialise although a report was made. Loved Sydney but less than impressed with the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a good experience”
Reviews.Author: kirkw00d
Reviews.Content: We booked a "refurbished 4.5 star" studio apartment for two nights at a very good rate, but were quite apprehensive about what we would find after subsequently reading the Trip Advisor reviews. Either many of the problems experienced by other reviewers have been fixed or we were lucky. The reception staff we dealt with were pleasant and helpful, we did not notice a smell in the lobby, our room was ready at 2pm, both (admittedly creaky) lifts were working and the swimming pool water was heated. Our 6th floor studio apartment was clean, comfortable and quite spacious, the kitchen area was bigger and better equipped than expected and there was a nice view over Hyde Park. The bathroom was quite small but was clean and in good repair. On the minus side, the furniture and finishes, though perfectly adequate, were not what we would call 4.5 star and there was a lack of attention to detail and quality control in the maintenance and daily room servicing (rough and ready raw wood frame around the air conditioning unit, bed not remade properly, room not vacuumed). This property is on the corner of two very busy streets and there is traffic noise, but we were not bothered by it, despite having the window open all the time. Since other reviews have been so bad we might hesitate to recommend this accommodation to others, but given the excellent location and the low rate we paid, we were very satisfied and enjoyed out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: WestieCrowFamily
Reviews.Content: After reading the other comments on Trip Advisor about the Hyde Park Plaza, I thought Iâ€™d booked the family into a dump. However, from our experience, the Hotel was a lot better than we were lead to believe. Yes, there was a bit of a smell from time to time in the foyer, but it wasnâ€™t noticeable all the time. Check in was from 2 pm & our room was available from about 2.15pm. So we had a small wait. Generally all of the staff were friendly. Mind you, there was one guy that could do with a personality injection. He, however wasnâ€™t rude though, just not very talkative. The Room itself was a 2 bedroom with kitchen. It was neat, clean and actually quite roomy (the bathroom was a bit small though, but still quite usable). The beds were comfortable and made daily, towels were changed daily & bins emptied. There were enough utensils etc in the kitchen to make it easy enough to prepare some basic meals. Everything in the suite seemed to work OK. The view we had from our room over Hyde Park was excellent and the location to the trains, buses and the CDB was also very convenient. Based on comments read on Trip Advisor we did try the Glenmore Hotel in the Rocks (right near the BridgeClimb). We found it to be a treasure. We ended up there on a Monday night, which was $10 Steak night. The steaks we had were excellent, as was the nachos & chips the kids had. The view from the rooftop Beer Garden was also pretty specky. Overall, I thought the room we had was neat & tidy.

Reviews.Title: “In need of updating”
Reviews.Author: Sandylane9
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was an apartment and close to the city. Arrived late at night. first room had no air conditioning and was overlooking the park, traffic noise all the time so we were moved straight away. Next room had broken kitchen doors, leather sofa ripped and saggy, cigarette burns on other furniture. Moved a third time to the back of the "hotel" although quieter, room badly renovated, windows would not close and blew open in the wind. No disabled facilities and only one lift working to service 15 floors,complained and got 10% discount. This was supposed to be a 4.5 star room !!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rdg66
Reviews.Content: Never ever will we stay there again. The room was hopeless. We had constant dripping taps. Wires hanging out of our bedside lamp. A broken cealing rose, with the wires exposed. A broken patio door lock and would not close properly. When we reported all the faults the very next morning. We were told never mind wehen we are not too busy we will get out man to look at the complaint. We were glad that we were there only for four nights and still alive.

Reviews.Title: “Hyde Park Plaza - Old Smelly Building”
Reviews.Author: fhec
Reviews.Content: Smelly old and dirty building, noisy...expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “One lift only working for almost 100 rooms, noise, two days without water!!!”
Reviews.Author: a2008australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for more than a week - for the amount of money we paid, it was very expensive, it is not worthed. The hotel building is old, there are two guest lifts, but only one was working, even we and other guests complaints, it was ignored. They advised nothing they can do to fix other lift! The lifts are old and we wonder if it is safe to use. We were also been advised to use maintenance lifts instead if there were many guests quequing for one working lift. This is not acceptable!!! The pool spa was never worked. The other problem, it is noisy and most the times, you can hear noise from other rooms. Also during our stay, two days without water as the pump for the building doesn't work for most rooms. We confirmed this with other rooms!!! We had spoken to other guests, they had the same opinion that they had paid too much for bad services/facilities. Suggestion: If you are planning to find accomodation, especially in Sydney, please check around, no rush even in peak season, compared the price between different accomodation places. Please remember do not use individual/private company services, as a guest, you may well look after by well known company name or book direct to the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastandrew
Reviews.Content: Oaks Hyde Park is situated in a great location on the main Park and is a short stroll to the city and train station. This is where the good part finishes. Check in was ok although we had to be let in to the room as the room key wasn't working. We stayed in the refurbished "4.5" star room. It clearly was an old room with a lick of new paint and some newish furniture put in it. The room and hallways smell dank and smoky. The view from the small balcony was of a car park. The room has all that you need but is not really modern and what you would normally expect from the Oaks. We also found that the place was falling apart with the air con remote not working, and the towel rails in the bathroom falling off the wall and towel hooks missing from the door. Overall this place is ok if you need a bed to sleep in for the night, but if you intend to stay for more than one day i'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Weekender!”
Reviews.Author: Enigmablue
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short weekend away for a mate's birthday. We (2 couples) booked a 2 bed apt for au$180 per night so its was good value and it's in a fantastic location. Excellent for CBD and tourist stuff but also good to get a bit rough and ready with the locals along Oxford Street. Good points: Location. Also nice view, ease of check-in, check-out and left luggage. Good size bedrooms and large living room area with comfy sofas. Bad Points: It's noisy all night (lucky i was a bit tipsy when i got back from Oxford St). We had a 13th floor room facing Hyde Park but it must be the busiest route for all fire engines, ambulances and police cars in the CBD! Tiny bathroom with no shower pressure. Decor needs updating as its like a dodgy IKEA set. Overall, 7/10 for me. Also recommend The Spanish Club, Liverpool St for some authentic tapas, Rambutan on Oxford Street for some funky thai food and excellent cocktails, The Glenmore pub at the Rocks for its roof top bar, coldies and views of the Opera House and of course Max Brenners for all that lovely chocolate. These tips courtesy of our Brissie mate who calls Sydney home and which ensured we had a blast this weekend!

Reviews.Title: “park bench would of been more comfortable”
Reviews.Author: katoombatyrant
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by rushed and just barely polite desk staff ,given our room card car park code and sent off .The car park is not under cover which in it self is no problem but the narrow one way drive way is ,if you are unlucky enough to encounter a car coming down as you are driving up your troubles have only just begune .Once playing dodgem car is complete you enter the service areas of the hotel and attempt to find the lift ,exiting the lift the hall ways are old and unkept of a class i havrnt seen for 30 years .Room 415 4 star my BUTT.Yes it had been newly painted it was resonably clean the tv did work but the bed , oh my god it was so hard it felt like and ensomble base not a mattress you could feel springs and various peices of metal digging into your back , my wife and my self endad up sleeping on the fold out it was fractionly more comfortable . IT was cheap 167 aus and it would want to be , you only get what you pay for was the case here wont be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: roadhogCT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our daughter and neice spent 6 days in Sydney at the Park Plaza. The location is excellent, right on Hyde Park. It is reasonably close to the subway, restaurants, cafes, shopping and major attractions Our room was updated and spotlessly clean. There is no restaurant, bar or internet on site. There is a rooftop pool, but it was unuseable as the pool heater was not working and the water was cold. There is a nice hot tub on the roof. We rented our studio apartment directly from the apartment owner, George C. from an add posted on Sydney craigslist, so we did not deal with the hotel staff at all. Overall, we found it to be a very good value and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DonnyBrisbane
